paper_title.en: Synthesis and properties of TSF-based spin-polarized donor

description.en: A novel organic donor radical, TSBN, which is a benzotetraselenafulvalene derivative carrying a nitronyl nitroxide group in a cross-conjugated manner was prepared. X-ray crystallographic analysis revealed that TSBN forms a sheet-like network within the ac plane through intermolecular chalcogen contacts. Its spin-polarized structure was confirmed by cyclic voltammogram, ESR spectra of singly oxidized species and DFT calculation. The neutral crystal of TSBN showed nonlinear I-V characteristics at 2 K and exhibited negative magnetoresistance (-5% at 2 K under 5 T). (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Synthesis and properties of TSF-based spin-polarized donor

description.en: A novel organic donor radical, TSBN, which is a benzotetraselenafulvalene derivative carrying a nitronyl nitroxide group in a cross-conjugated manner was prepared. X-ray crystallographic analysis revealed that TSBN forms a sheet-like network within the ac plane through intermolecular chalcogen contacts. Its spin-polarized structure was confirmed by cyclic voltammogram, ESR spectra of singly oxidized species and DFT calculation. The neutral crystal of TSBN showed nonlinear I-V characteristics at 2 K and exhibited negative magnetoresistance (-5% at 2 K under 5 T). (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Negative magneto-resistance observed on an ion-radical salt of a TTF-based spin-polarized donor

description.en: A novel diselena analogue of TTF-based spin-polarized donor was synthesized. An ion-radical salt of the donor electro-crystallized on an interdigitated electrode with 2 mu m gap showed negative magneto-resistance below 15 K. This is the first example detecting the interaction between localized spin and conducting electron in a genuine organic system.

paper_title.en: Negative magneto-resistance observed on an ion-radical salt of a TTF-based spin-polarized donor

description.en: A novel diselena analogue of TTF-based spin-polarized donor was synthesized. An ion-radical salt of the donor electro-crystallized on an interdigitated electrode with 2 mu m gap showed negative magneto-resistance below 15 K. This is the first example detecting the interaction between localized spin and conducting electron in a genuine organic system.

paper_title.en: Electron transport in networks of gold nanoparticles connected by oligothiophene molecular wires

description.en: Network structures made of pi-conjugated molecular wires of oligothiophene 3mer, or 9mer carrying thiol groups at alpha,omega-positions, and gold nanoparticles with average diameter of 4 nm were prepared on interdigitated gold electrodes. Observation of the resultant assemblies by means of FE-SEM and TEM revealed that the gold nanoparticles were connected by pi-molecular wires to form a network. The networks exhibited thermally activated electron transport at room temperature with activation energies of 21and 45 meV for 3mer- and 9mer-networks, respectively, and these values were almost the same as those of networks connected with non-conjugated molecules having similar lengths. However, the activation energy became very small (similar to 0.1 meV) at temperatures lower than 30 K and non-linear current - voltage characteristics (I proportional to V(3)) appeared in pi-conjugated networks at 4.2 K. These results suggest that the gold nanoparticles in the networks work as Coulomb islands and the temperature-independent behavior at lower temperatures can be interpreted in terms of a co-tunneling mechanism.

paper_title.en: Electron transport in networks of gold nanoparticles connected by oligothiophene molecular wires

description.en: Network structures made of pi-conjugated molecular wires of oligothiophene 3mer, or 9mer carrying thiol groups at alpha,omega-positions, and gold nanoparticles with average diameter of 4 nm were prepared on interdigitated gold electrodes. Observation of the resultant assemblies by means of FE-SEM and TEM revealed that the gold nanoparticles were connected by pi-molecular wires to form a network. The networks exhibited thermally activated electron transport at room temperature with activation energies of 21and 45 meV for 3mer- and 9mer-networks, respectively, and these values were almost the same as those of networks connected with non-conjugated molecules having similar lengths. However, the activation energy became very small (similar to 0.1 meV) at temperatures lower than 30 K and non-linear current - voltage characteristics (I proportional to V(3)) appeared in pi-conjugated networks at 4.2 K. These results suggest that the gold nanoparticles in the networks work as Coulomb islands and the temperature-independent behavior at lower temperatures can be interpreted in terms of a co-tunneling mechanism.

paper_title.en: A field-effect transistor consists of spin-polarized TTF-based donor

description.en: TTF-based organic donor molecule bearing stable organic radical moiety and long alkyl chains was synthesized and fabricated into a FET device structure. A fused solid film of the donor radical on a surface-oxidized silicon wafer with an interdigited electrode of 2 mu m gap as source and drain electrodes indicated FET characteristics although the observed hole mobility was very low. This is the first observation of a FET characteristic of an organic radical molecule. (c) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: A field-effect transistor consists of spin-polarized TTF-based donor

description.en: TTF-based organic donor molecule bearing stable organic radical moiety and long alkyl chains was synthesized and fabricated into a FET device structure. A fused solid film of the donor radical on a surface-oxidized silicon wafer with an interdigited electrode of 2 mu m gap as source and drain electrodes indicated FET characteristics although the observed hole mobility was very low. This is the first observation of a FET characteristic of an organic radical molecule. (c) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Polyhedral building block with specific facial interaction for conducting supramolecular self-assembly

description.en: A novel dimeric donor with an edge-sliced tetrahedral shape was synthesized. This dimeric donor consists of two donor planes which are connected in a perpendicular orientation by four diselenatrimethylene chains, and can be regarded as a pre-organized building block for constructing a conductive supramolecular self-assembly containing log-stack type channels of a three-dimensional topology.

paper_title.en: Polyhedral building block with specific facial interaction for conducting supramolecular self-assembly

description.en: A novel dimeric donor with an edge-sliced tetrahedral shape was synthesized. This dimeric donor consists of two donor planes which are connected in a perpendicular orientation by four diselenatrimethylene chains, and can be regarded as a pre-organized building block for constructing a conductive supramolecular self-assembly containing log-stack type channels of a three-dimensional topology.

paper_title.en: Design and preparation of pyrrole-based spin-polarized donors

description.en: As a fundamental building block of a conductive magnetic macromolecule, a series of pyrrole derivatives carrying a nitronyl nitroxide (NN) group was prepared. Some of these derivatives afforded ground-state triplet diradical cations upon one-electron oxidation, and the difference in the spin multiplicities of the singly oxidized pyrrolylNNs was rationalized on the basis of a perturbational molecular orbital method. The electronic interaction between the pyrrole and the nitronyl nitroxide parts was also confirmed by cyclic voltammetry and UV-Vis absorption spectroscopy. In spite of the vacancy of the 2 and 5 positions of the pyrrole ring, electrochemical polymerization of these derivatives was not observed, except for an extended alpha-thienyl derivative.

paper_title.ja: Design of Spin-Polarized Molecular Wire as a Prototypeal Unimolecular Quantum Spin Device

paper_title.en: Design and preparation of pyrrole-based spin-polarized donors

description.en: As a fundamental building block of a conductive magnetic macromolecule, a series of pyrrole derivatives carrying a nitronyl nitroxide (NN) group was prepared. Some of these derivatives afforded ground-state triplet diradical cations upon one-electron oxidation, and the difference in the spin multiplicities of the singly oxidized pyrrolylNNs was rationalized on the basis of a perturbational molecular orbital method. The electronic interaction between the pyrrole and the nitronyl nitroxide parts was also confirmed by cyclic voltammetry and UV-Vis absorption spectroscopy. In spite of the vacancy of the 2 and 5 positions of the pyrrole ring, electrochemical polymerization of these derivatives was not observed, except for an extended alpha-thienyl derivative.
